intro: Heliosperma trojanensis, commonly known as the Trojan sunspire, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun exposure to flourish. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
